TABLES COME FIRST FIRST SERVE! = please arrive on time, John Harvards cannot hold tables indefinitely.

Thanks to Nerd Fun, welcome to this Intellectual Snob DEBATE -- Chap XXIV. Be there or be square: we'll have reserved tall tables behind the reception area. There will be no pressure to order food. Please move between tables & greet each other. Please bring CASH to help out your patient waitstaff!

Here is the actual (acted out English rendition abbreviated) 1909 Futurist manifesto by Marinetti --:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HY8kVa0qB9Q

The Russian co-founder of Futurism Klebnikov wrote like this 10 years laterÂ  in "The Radio of the Future," a bit sarcastically. Nearly the same year Zamyatin published "We," the ingenious daring & controversial dystopian novel just recently rediscovered & included in literature courses now taught at Harvard:

"We," along with Taylorism, was a prime inspiration for Orwell & of course Huxley.

Metropolis, a fascinating script play/ novel by Thea von Harbou (published 1926) was also an incredible rendition of the future made into a movie by her husband Fritz Lang. It envisaged cars flying through space etc.-- (actually some were marketed in 1939, called Cierva Autogyros); at the time luxury airships were the main alternative means to intercontinental travel.

HG Wells predicted aerial warfare in 1900 (novel: the Sleeper Wakes) & nuclear war (novel: The Last War-- 1920!).

How have the predictions, actually matched up with what we have today? How realistic were they? What are the current predictions for the future-- ?


Above painting= "Abstract Speed & Sound" -- 1914.

You don't have to be a genuine intellectual-- pseudo-intellectuals are also welcome.

Humor in good taste-- ALLOWED. Intellectual apparel: allowed. Startle the waitstaff with a fake mustache, goatee, Periwig, or monocle. Fold-up sunglasses, corduroy jackets with elbow patches-- allowed. No Meerschaum tobacco pipes, please. Absinthe is not served.

All you need is an aloof attitude full of irony or some baffling ideas, or-- dare I say it-- some unanswered question you wish to convey incognito.
item.name: Intellectual Snob Meetup Chap XXIV -- Visions of the Future!
